titleStmt.title: The maiden's tragedy: or, A brief account of a young damsel near Wolverhampton, who cut her throat in despair, because she could not have the man she lov'd. To the tune of Russel's farewell. Licensed according to order.

The maiden's tragedy: or, A brief account of a young damsel near Wolverhampton, who cut her throat in despair, because she could not have the man she lov'd. To the tune of Russel's farewell. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the angel in Gilt-Spur-street, without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Imperfect: mounted and tightly bound with some loss of text.
Printed on verso: Then faction comes with his confused breath ...
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
